p: Type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM) is a life-threatening disease of the endocrine system and its prevalence is on the rise owing to the increasing trends of obesity and sedentary lifestyles [ 1, 2]. These escalating trends have made diabetes mellitus (DM) a global epidemic as its burden is evidently noticeable in both developed and developing regions [ 3]. T2DM is characterized by dysfunctional Î² pancreatic cells, insulin resistance, hyperglycemia, dyslipidemia and other metabolic disturbances like oxidative stress and low-grade inflammation collectively leading to deleterious complications [ 4, 5].
